properties.Narrative:
Video evidence confirmed a brief tornado near Corning. No damage
indicators were available to provide a rating.
Preliminary path only. Ground Survey has not been completed. No reports of damage. Path location in DAT chosen based loosely to corroborate with open farm fields in foreground.

A storm chaser captured video of a brief tornado south of Satartia and west of MS Highway 3 in the vicinity of Dixie Farm Rd. No damage was found during a survey of the area, so this tornado will be rated EF-Unknown.

A BRIEF TORNADO (LANDSPOUT) WAS CAPTURED ON VIDEO OVER AN EMPTY FIELD BETWEEN CONVOY HELLER ROAD AND WARD ROAD, JUST NORTH OF FEASBY WISENER ROAD. A FUNNEL, AS WELL AS DIRT BEING LIFTED OFF THE GROUND, WERE OBSERVED FOR A BRIEF PERIOD. NO DAMAGE WAS REPORTED, RESULTING IN THE TORNADO BEING CLASSIFIED AS AN EF-U WITH NO MAX WIND SPEED. THE PATH LENGTH AND WIDTH ARE ESTIMATED AT AROUND A QUARTER MILE AND 20 YARDS WIDE RESPECITVELY.

After extensive analysis of data provided by PERiLs, sentinel sattelite imagery, and third-party pressure data in conjunction with multiple surrounding radars it has been determined that another tornado occurred 1 mile NNW of Petrey, AL on 4/5/2022. This tornado was associated with the line segment that was moving through the area roughly 25 minutes after the intial tornado producing supercell. During the initial storm survey there were several discrepancies noted in the overall damage path that did not quite line up with the initial tornado path including snapped/uprooted trees by a pond and the damage done to the southern portion of the chicken houses. Given the overlapping paths and likely similar start points, it is impossible to determine what the true intensity, path width, path length, and end point of this tornado was. The beginning time of the tornado is estimated by radar and third party pressure data. Special thanks to all parties involved for providing invaluable data that supported this determination.

Approximate path of tornado through along Colquitt-Worth County line into extreme southern Tift County. Tornado was confirmed via video on social media and photo from emergency management. Other than a few trees down, no damage of note has been reported from this tornado, which passed through mostly farmland and unpopulated rural areas. Therefore, the rating is left as EF Unknown. The location and time is estimated from the video, photos, and radar data.

A tornado was documented by pictures and videos over the Fort Hood military base. This area is undeveloped and has little access. No damage was reported. Times and path were determined by using visual reports and radar tracking of a tornadic debris signature.

Trained spotters reported, and video evidence confirmed that a tornado developed and moved between 392 and 378 road near O street at 643 PM. The tornado caused no known damage and was short lived, but confidence in total track length is low given lack of damage indicators and only shortened video evidence. Maximum width was approximated using video evidence.
